Research

Here's some information about the work I do, that I find particularly interesting.
Send me a message if we have overlapping interests.
üéØ Zero-Shot Generalisation
Show a monkey how to stack some bricks, and it‚Äôll ace the job no matter the shape, color, or pose. Teach the same trick to a DL model, and watch it have an aneurism because the colour of the brick changed. Personally, I'm not a fan of drowning models in heaps of training data, so how do we craft domain-invariant policies? Let‚Äôs figure this out before Wirth pops up with a "I told you so"‚Äîif he hasn‚Äôt already!‚Äù

Zero-shot Generalisation in DRL Survey - really nice survey on this topic by the lot in DARK labs, UCL.
Open-Ended Learning - I can't tell if I love or hate this paper yet, but I know you have to read it.
Domain Generalisation Survey - a broader look at the problem of domain invariance.
Generalisation in Cooperative MARL - an interesting look into comnbinatorial generalisation.
üß† Representation Learning
When you learn something new, what does it even mean to understand it? It's something we do quasi-proactively; half the time, it's like a mental magic trick we perform almost on autopilot. This notion of learning in DL is usually achieved via representation learning, where a model learns representations from raw data. This currently works pretty dang well in single-domain supervised learning tasks, but how can we create representations that are more representative of the mess of a world we live in?

I-JEPA - can you even talk about representation learning without mentioning Yann's work?
V-JEPA - V0.2 of Yann's vision.
Representation Learning Review - old but gold.
Multimodal Representation Learning - what it says on the tin.
üîÑ Continual Learning
What is this myth of the objective? Does it even exist, or are we just chasing shadows? Surely, models should be built just like us, ever-learning. The real question "how do we design an algorithm that will last for a million years?" (I don't know who said this first but it definitely wasn't me).

Continual Learning Survey
Another Continual Learning Survey - Both of these surveys are great
A Definition of Continual Learning - a definition of continual DRL by one of my PhD supervisors.
üìú Magnus Finis¬†
What the heck is the point of all this anyway? What's the end goal? How do we even get there? Well, here are a few interesting takes.

The Alberta Plan - Richard Sutton's take.
Path to AMI - Yann LeCun's take.
The Big World Hypothesis - 5 pages to change your mindset on the problem.

experience

    generating explanations with large language models for science & medicine, working in the deep learning group

    Summer '21-Summer '22, Spring '20, Summer '19

    worked at paige ai as a research scientist developing deep learning models for pathology -- also worked at pacmed ai in 2019 and response4life covid forecasting in 2020

  • phd at uc berkeley
    Fall '17-Spring '22

    researched interpretable machine learning, especially for neural networks and in scientific applications, working in the bin yu group

  • big tech internships
    Summer '17, Summer '20

    worked on unsupervised semantic segmentation at meta ai, and worked on causal fairness benchmarking in computer vision at aws

  • undergrad
    summer '14- spring '17

    worked on graphical models under Yanjun Qi and on biophysical modeling under William Levy -- also spent 3 summers doing research at HHMI Janelia under Srini Turaga
